thread.title: Ireland Faces Shifting Currents in Its Ties to EU

author: Simon Nixon
title: Ireland Faces Shifting Currents in Its Ties to EU
text:
Ireland may be the most pro-European country in the European Union. Some 87% of Irish citizens think EU membership is good for the country, according to a poll last year, and only 12% think Ireland should follow the U.K. out of the EU. The most recent Eurobarometer survey found that 80% of Irish citizens are confident about the outlook for the EU, the highest of any member state.
Yet despite this optimism, Irelandâ€™s relationship with the EU is bound to get more complicated.
